skill.name: matplotlib
skill.description: Foundational plotting library. Create line plots, scatter, bar, histograms, heatmaps, 3D, subplots, export PNG/PDF/SVG, for scientific visualization and publication figures.
skill.summary: Foundational plotting library. Create line plots, scatter, bar, histograms, heatmaps, 3D, subplots, ...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or network exfiltration patterns were found. Scripts focus on local plotting and optional file output only.

content.value_statement: You need clear, reliable guidance for matplotlib plots. This skill gives templates and style tools for clean, consistent figures.
actual_capabilities: Provide templates for line, scatter, bar, histogram, heatmap, contour, box, violin, and 3D plots.
Create multi-panel figures using GridSpec and subplot layouts.
Apply predefined style presets for publication, presentation, web, dark, and minimal themes.
Generate and save custom .mplstyle files from configured settings.
Export figures to image or vector formats with DPI control.
limitations: Does not install matplotlib or other dependencies.
Does not fetch data from files or external APIs.
Interactive previews require a local graphical backend.
Does not build web dashboards or interactive browser charts.

use_cases.title: Report-ready plots
use_cases.description: Create consistent figures for reports and slide decks with clean styling.

use_cases.title: Publication figures
use_cases.description: Produce high-resolution plots with proper labels, legends, and layout.

use_cases.title: Teaching visuals
use_cases.description: Generate clear example plots for lectures and tutorials.

prompt_templates.title: Basic line plot
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a simple line plot of y versus x with title, labels, and grid. Use the object oriented interface.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-panel figure
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a 2x2 subplot figure with line, scatter, bar, and histogram. Add titles and shared styling.

prompt_templates.title: Styled publication plot
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply a publication style, set figure size and DPI, and export a PNG and PDF with tight layout.

prompt_templates.title: Custom style file
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a custom .mplstyle file with font, line, and grid settings, then preview it.

output_examples.input: Make a publication-quality line and scatter plot with shared x-axis and save as PNG.
output: Uses object oriented interface with two aligned subplots
Applies clean labels, legend, and grid
Exports a 300 DPI PNG with tight layout

best_practices: Use the object oriented interface for complex figures.
Set figure size and DPI at creation for consistent output.
Use constrained layout or tight layout to avoid overlaps.
anti_patterns: Relying on implicit pyplot state for multi-plot figures.
Using rainbow colormaps for quantitative data.
Saving low DPI figures for print use.

faq.question: Is this compatible with standard matplotlib?
faq.answer: Yes, it uses standard matplotlib APIs and works with typical Python setups.

faq.question: What are the limits of the templates?
faq.answer: They cover common plot types but do not replace custom domain-specific logic.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with Jupyter?
faq.answer: Yes, the templates work in notebooks with inline or interactive backends.

faq.question: Does it access my data or credentials?
faq.answer: No, it does not access credentials, environment variables, or network data.

faq.question: What if plots do not display?
faq.answer: Check that a graphical backend is available or use notebook inline mode.

faq.question: How does it compare to seaborn?
faq.answer: It focuses on core matplotlib control rather than high-level statistical defaults.
